metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1924 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The opj_tgt_reset function in OpenJpeg 2016.1.18 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a crafted JPEG 2000 image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
